options.text: Dedicated subscriptions are recommended for the various platform components to ensure scale, sustainability, and segregation of duties. However, a single subscription can also be used in case this is not a concern (e.g., small enterprises).

options.text: Microsoft Cloud for Healthcare provides capabilities to manage health data at scale and make it easier for healthcare organizations to improve the patient experience, coordinate care, and drive operational efficiency, while helping support security, compliance, and interoperability of health data.
Microsoft Cloud for Healthcare will create the resource group and deploy the Healthcare APIs with additional, optional services into the selected subscription.

elements.toolTip: Select the target region for your Healthcare APIs

options.text: The Azure Healthcare APIs workspace is a logical container for all your healthcare service instances such as Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR) services, Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DICOM) services, and Internet of things (IoT) Connectors. The workspace also creates a compliance boundary (HIPAA, HITRUST) within which protected health information can travel.
You can optionally assign required data RBAC to interact with the Healthcare APIs during the setup.

The FHIR service in the Azure Healthcare APIs enables rapid exchange of data through Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR) APIs, backed by a managed Platform-as-a Service (PaaS) offering in the cloud. It makes it easier for anyone working with health data to ingest, manage, and persist Protected Health Information PHI in the cloud.

elements.name: enableStorageAccount
elements.label: Create and integrate storage account with FHIR

elements.name: storageSelector
elements.label: Select existing storage account that will be integrated with FHIR

options.text: DICOM (Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine) is the international standard to transmit, store, retrieve, print, process, and display medical imaging information, and is the primary medical imaging standard accepted across healthcare.
IoT Connector is an optional feature of Azure Healthcare APIs that provides the capability to ingest data from Internet of Medical Things (IoMT) devices.

AI-powered virtual health assistant, that help to improve processes and reduce costs. It allows you to offer your users intelligent and personalized access to health-related information and interactions through a natural conversation experience

Access to diagnostic logs is essential for any healthcare service where compliance with regulatory requirements (such as HIPAA) is a must, and it is recommended to enable Azure Monitor to collect metrics and logs to a Log Analytics workspace. Create a new dedicated Log Analytics workspace for your Healthcare API application, or use an existing Log Analytics workspace.
Microsoft Cloud for Healthcare industry requires dedicated Environments in Power Platform with Dataverse. You can use existing Environments, or create new Environments (recommended).
